refnamediv.refpurpose: Font and other attributes for annotating text

refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Attributed text is used in a number of places in Pango. It is used as the input to the itemization process and also when creating a PangoLayout. The data types and functions in this section are used to represent and manipulate sets of attributes applied to a portion of text.

refsect2.title: enum PangoAttrType
refsect2.programlisting: typedef enum { PANGO_ATTR_INVALID, /* 0 is an invalid attribute type */ PANGO_ATTR_LANGUAGE, /* PangoAttrLanguage */ PANGO_ATTR_FAMILY, /* PangoAttrString */ PANGO_ATTR_STYLE, /* PangoAttrInt */ PANGO_ATTR_WEIGHT, /* PangoAttrInt */ PANGO_ATTR_VARIANT, /* PangoAttrInt */ PANGO_ATTR_STRETCH, /* PangoAttrInt */ PANGO_ATTR_SIZE, /* PangoAttrSize */ PANGO_ATTR_FONT_DESC, /* PangoAttrFontDesc */ PANGO_ATTR_FOREGROUND, /* PangoAttrColor */ PANGO_ATTR_BACKGROUND, /* PangoAttrColor */ PANGO_ATTR_UNDERLINE, /* PangoAttrInt */ PANGO_ATTR_STRIKETHROUGH, /* PangoAttrInt */ PANGO_ATTR_RISE, /* PangoAttrInt */ PANGO_ATTR_SHAPE, /* PangoAttrShape */ PANGO_ATTR_SCALE, /* PangoAttrFloat */ PANGO_ATTR_FALLBACK /* PangoAttrInt */ } PangoAttrType;
refsect2.para: distinguishes between different types of attributes. Along with the predefined values, it is possible to allocate additional values for custom attributes using pango_attr_type_register(). The predefined values are given below. The type of structure used to store the attribute is listed in parentheses after the description.

listitem.simpara: font size in points divided by PANGO_SCALE (PangoAttrInt)
whether the text has an underline (PangoAttrInt)

refsect2.title: PANGO_TYPE_ATTR_TYPE
refsect2.para: The GObject type for PangoAttrType.

refsect2.title: struct PangoAttrClass
refsect2.para: The PangoAttrClass structure stores the type and operations for a particular type of attribute. The functions in this structure should not be called directly. Instead, one should use the wrapper functions provided for PangoAttribute.

listitem.simpara: the type ID for this attribute
function to duplicate an attribute of this type (see pango_attribute_copy())
function to free an attribute of this type (see pango_attribute_destroy())

refsect2.title: struct PangoAttribute
refsect2.para: The PangoAttribute structure represents the common portions of all attributes. Particular types of attributes include this structure as their initial portion. The common portion of the attribute holds the range to which the value in the type-specific part of the attribute applies.

listitem.simpara: the class structure holding information about the type of the attribute
the start index of the range.
end index of the range. The character at this index is not included in the range.

refsect2.title: struct PangoAttrString
refsect2.para: The PangoAttrString structure is used to represent attributes with a string value.

listitem.simpara: the common portion of the attribute
the string which is the value of the attribute

refsect2.title: struct PangoAttrLanguage
refsect2.para: The PangoAttrColor structure is used to represent attributes that are languages.

listitem.simpara: the common portion of the attribute
the PangoLanguage which is the value of the attribute

refsect2.title: struct PangoAttrColor
refsect2.para: The PangoAttrColor structure is used to represent attributes that are colors.

listitem.simpara: the common portion of the attribute
the PangoColor which is the value of the attribute

refsect2.title: struct PangoAttrInt
refsect2.para: The PangoAttrInt structure is used to represent attributes with a integer or enumeration value.

listitem.simpara: the common portion of the attribute

refsect2.title: struct PangoAttrFloat
refsect2.para: The PangoAttrFloat structure is used to represent attributes with a float or double value.

listitem.simpara: the common portion of the attribute

refsect2.title: struct PangoAttrFontDesc
refsect2.para: The PangoAttrFontDesc structure is used to store an attribute that sets all aspects of the font description at once.

listitem.simpara: the common portion of the attribute
the font description which is the value of this attribute

refsect2.title: struct PangoAttrShape
refsect2.para: The PangoAttrShape structure is used to represent attributes which impose shape restrictions.

listitem.simpara: the common portion of the attribute
the ink rectangle to restrict to
the logical rectangle to restrict to

refsect2.title: pango_parse_markup ()
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean pango_parse_markup (const char *markup_text, int length, gunichar accel_marker, PangoAttrList **attr_list, char **text, gunichar *accel_char, GError **error);
refsect2.para: Parses marked-up text (see markup format) to create a plaintext string and an attribute list.

If accel_marker is nonzero, the given character will mark the character following it as an accelerator. For example, the accel marker might be an ampersand or underscore. All characters marked as an accelerator will receive a PANGO_UNDERLINE_LOW attribute, and the first character so marked will be returned in accel_char. Two accel_marker characters following each other produce a single literal accel_marker character.

listitem.simpara: length of markup_text, or -1 if nul-terminated
character that precedes an accelerator, or 0 for none
address of return location for a PangoAttrList, or NULL
address of return location for text with tags stripped, or NULL
address of return location for accelerator char, or NULL
address of return location for errors, or NULL
FALSE if error is set, otherwise TRUE

refsect2.title: pango_attr_type_register ()
refsect2.para: Allocate a new attribute type ID.

listitem.simpara: an identifier for the type. (Currently unused.)

refsect2.para: Make a copy of an attribute.

refsect2.title: pango_attribute_equal ()
refsect2.para: Compare two attributes for equality. This compares only the actual value of the two attributes and not the ranges that the attributes apply to.

listitem.simpara: TRUE if the two attributes have the same value.

refsect2.para: Create a new font stretch attribute

refsect2.title: pango_attr_weight_new ()
refsect2.para: Create a new font weight attribute.

listitem.simpara: the font size, in PANGO_SCALEths of a point.

refsect2.para: Create a new font description attribute. (This attribute allows setting family, style, weight, variant, stretch, and size simultaneously.)

refsect2.title: pango_attr_foreground_new ()
refsect2.para: Create a new foreground color attribute.

refsect2.title: pango_attr_background_new ()
refsect2.para: Create a new background color attribute.

refsect2.title: pango_attr_strikethrough_new ()
refsect2.para: Create a new font strike-through attribute.

listitem.simpara: TRUE if the text should be struck-through.

refsect2.title: pango_attr_underline_new ()
refsect2.para: Create a new underline-style object.

refsect2.title: enum PangoUnderline
refsect2.para: the PangoUnderline enumeration is used to specify whether text should be underlined, and if so, the type of underlining.

listitem.simpara: a single underline should be drawn.
a double underline should be drawn.

a single underline should be drawn at a position beneath the ink extents of the text being underlined. This should be used only for underlining single characters, such as for keyboard accelerators. PANGO_UNDERLINE_SINGLE should be used for extended portions of text.
a wavy underline should be drawn below. This underline is typically used to indicate an error such as a possilble mispelling; in some cases an contrasting color may automatically be used.

refsect2.title: PANGO_TYPE_UNDERLINE
refsect2.para: The GObject type for PangoUnderline.

refsect2.title: pango_attr_shape_new ()
refsect2.para: Create a new shape attribute. A shape is used to impose a particular ink and logical rect on the result of shaping a particular glyph. This might be used, for instance, for embedding a picture or a widget inside a PangoLayout.

listitem.simpara: ink rectangle to assign to each character
logical rectangle assign to each character

refsect2.title: pango_attr_scale_new ()
refsect2.para: Create a new font size scale attribute. The base font for the affected text will have its size multiplied by scale_factor.

refsect2.title: pango_attr_fallback_new ()
refsect2.para: Create a new font fallback attribute.

If fallback is disabled, characters will only be used from the closest matching font on the system. No fallback will be done to other fonts on the system that might contain the characters in the text.

listitem.simpara: TRUE if we should fall back on other fonts for characters the active font is missing.

refsect2.title: PANGO_SCALE_XX_SMALL
refsect2.para: The scale factor for three shrinking steps (1 / (1.2 * 1.2 * 1.2)).

refsect2.title: PANGO_SCALE_X_SMALL
refsect2.para: The scale factor for two shrinking steps (1 / (1.2 * 1.2)).

refsect2.title: PANGO_SCALE_SMALL
refsect2.para: The scale factor for one shrinking step (1 / 1.2).

refsect2.title: PANGO_SCALE_MEDIUM
refsect2.para: The scale factor for normal size (1.0).

refsect2.title: PANGO_SCALE_LARGE
refsect2.para: The scale factor for one magnification step (1.2).

refsect2.title: PANGO_SCALE_X_LARGE
refsect2.para: The scale factor for two magnification steps (1.2 * 1.2).

refsect2.title: PANGO_SCALE_XX_LARGE
refsect2.para: The scale factor for three magnification steps (1.2 * 1.2 * 1.2).

refsect2.title: pango_attr_rise_new ()
refsect2.para: Create a new baseline displacement attribute.

listitem.simpara: the amount that the text should be displaced vertically, in 10'000ths of an em. Positive values displace the text upwards.

refsect2.title: struct PangoColor
refsect2.para: The PangoColor structure is used to represent a color in an uncalibrated RGB colorspace.

listitem.simpara: The red component of the color. This is a value between 0 and 65535, with 65535 indicating full intensity.
The green component of the color. This is a value between 0 and 65535, with 65535 indicating full intensity.
The blue component of the color. This is a value between 0 and 65535, with 65535 indicating full intensity.

refsect2.title: PANGO_TYPE_COLOR
refsect2.para: The GObject type for PangoColor.

refsect2.title: pango_color_free ()
refsect2.para: Frees a color allocated by pango_color_copy().

refsect2.title: pango_color_parse ()
refsect2.para: Fill in the fields of a color from a string specification. The string can either one of a large set of standard names. (Taken from the X11 rgb.txt file), or it can be a hex value in the form '#rgb' '#rrggbb' '#rrrgggbbb' or '#rrrrggggbbbb' where 'r', 'g' and 'b' are hex digits of the red, green, and blue components of the color, respectively. (White in the four forms is '#fff' '#ffffff' '#fffffffff' and '#ffffffffffff')

listitem.simpara: a PangoColor structure in which to store the result
a string specifying the new color
TRUE if parsing of the specifier succeeded, otherwise false.

refsect2.title: pango_color_copy ()
refsect2.para: Creates a copy of src, which should be freed with pango_color_free(). Primarily used by language bindings, not that useful otherwise (since colors can just be copied by assignment in C).

refsect2.title: struct PangoLanguage
refsect2.para: The PangoLanguage structure is used to represent a language.
PangoLanguage pointers can be efficiently copied and compared with each other.

refsect2.title: PANGO_TYPE_LANGUAGE
refsect2.para: The GObject type for PangoLanguage.

refsect2.title: pango_language_from_string ()
refsect2.para: Take a RFC-3066 format language tag as a string and convert it to a PangoLanguage pointer that can be efficiently copied (copy the pointer) and compared with other language tags (compare the pointer.)
This function first canonicalizes the string by converting it to lowercase, mapping '_' to '-', and stripping all characters other than letters and '-'.

listitem.simpara: a string representing a language tag
an opaque pointer to a PangoLanguage structure. this will be valid forever after.

refsect2.title: pango_language_to_string()
refsect2.para: Returns a RFC-3066 format string representing the given language tag.

listitem.simpara: a string representing the language tag.

refsect2.title: pango_language_matches ()
refsect2.para: Checks if a language tag matches one of the elements in a list of language ranges. A language tag is considered to match a range in the list if the range is '*', the range is exactly the tag, or the range is a prefix of the tag, and the character after the tag is '-'.

listitem.simpara: a language tag (see pango_language_from_string()), NULL is allowed and matches nothing but '*'
a list of language ranges, separated by ';' characters. each element must either be '*', or a RFC 3066 language range canonicalized as by pango_language_from_string().
TRUE if a match was found.

refsect2.title: struct PangoAttrList
refsect2.para: The PangoAttrList structure represents a list of attributes that apply to a section of text. The attributes are, in general, allowed to overlap in an arbitrary fashion, however, if the attributes are manipulated only through pango_attr_list_change(), the overlap between properties will meet stricter criteria.

Since the PangoAttrList structure is stored as a linear list, it is not suitable for storing attributes for large amounts of text. In general, you should not use a single PangoAttrList for more than one paragraph of text.

refsect2.title: PANGO_TYPE_ATTR_LIST
refsect2.para: The GObject type for PangoAttrList.

refsect2.title: pango_attr_list_new ()
refsect2.para: Create a new empty attribute list with a reference count of 1.

refsect2.title: pango_attr_list_ref ()
refsect2.para: Increase the reference count of the given attribute list by one.

refsect2.title: pango_attr_list_unref ()
refsect2.para: Decrease the reference count of the given attribute list by one. If the result is zero, free the attribute list and the attributes it contains.

refsect2.title: pango_attr_list_copy ()
refsect2.para: Copy list and return an identical, new list.

refsect2.title: pango_attr_list_insert ()
refsect2.para: Insert the given attribute into the PangoAttrList. It will be inserted after all other attributes with a matching start_index.

listitem.simpara: the attribute to insert. Ownership of this value is assumed by the list.

refsect2.title: pango_attr_list_insert_before ()
refsect2.para: Insert the given attribute into the PangoAttrList. It will be inserted before all other attributes with a matching start_index.

listitem.simpara: the attribute to insert. Ownership of this value is assumed by the list.

refsect2.title: pango_attr_list_change ()
refsect2.para: Insert the given attribute into the PangoAttrList. It will replace any attributes of the same type on that segment and be merged with any adjoining attributes that are identical.

This function is slower than pango_attr_list_insert() for creating a attribute list in order (potentially much slower for large lists). However, pango_attr_list_insert() is not suitable for continually changing a set of attributes since it never removes or combines existing attributes.

listitem.simpara: the attribute to insert. Ownership of this value is assumed by the list.

refsect2.title: pango_attr_list_splice ()
refsect2.programlisting: void pango_attr_list_splice (PangoAttrList *list, PangoAttrList *other, gint pos, gint len);
refsect2.para: This function splices attribute list other into list. This operation is equivalent to stretching every attribute applies at position pos in list by an amount len, and then calling pango_attr_list_change() with a copy of each attributes in other in sequence (offset in position by pos).
This operation proves useful for, for instance, inserting a preedit string in the middle of an edit buffer.

listitem.simpara: the position in list at which to insert other
the length of the spliced segment. (Note that this must be specified since the attributes in other may only be present at some subsection of this range)

refsect2.title: pango_attr_list_filter ()
refsect2.para: Given a PangoAttrList and callback function, removes any elements of list for which func returns TRUE and inserts them into a new list.

listitem.simpara: callback function; returns TRUE if an atttribute should be filtered out.
Data to be passed to func
a newly allocated PangoAttrList or NULL if no attributes of the given types were found.

refsect2.title: PangoAttrFilterFunc ()
refsect2.para: A predicate function used by pango_attr_list_filter() to filter out a subset of attributes for a list.

listitem.simpara: TRUE if the attribute should be filtered out

refsect2.title: pango_attr_list_get_iterator ()
refsect2.para: Create a iterator initialized to the beginning of the list.

listitem.simpara: a new PangoIterator. list must not be modified until this iterator is freed with pango_attr_iterator_destroy().

refsect2.title: struct PangoAttrIterator
refsect2.para: The PangoAttrIterator structure is used to represent an iterator through a PangoList. A new iterator is created with pango_attr_list_get_iterator(). Once the iterator is created, it can be advanced through the style changes in the text using pango_attr_iterator_next(). At each style change, the range of the current style segment and the attributes currently in effect can be queried.

refsect2.title: pango_attr_iterator_copy ()
refsect2.para: Copy a PangoAttrIterator

refsect2.title: pango_attr_iterator_next ()
refsect2.para: Advance the iterator until the next change of style.

listitem.simpara: FALSE if the iterator is at the end of the list, otherwise TRUE

refsect2.title: pango_attr_iterator_range ()
refsect2.para: Get the range of the current segment.

listitem.simpara: location to store the start of the range
location to store the end of the range

refsect2.title: pango_attr_iterator_get ()
refsect2.para: Find the current attribute of a particular type at the iterator location. When multiple attributes of the same type overlap, the attribute whose range starts closest to the current location is used.

listitem.simpara: the type of attribute to find.
the current attribute of the given type, or NULL if no attribute of that type applies to the current location.

refsect2.title: pango_attr_iterator_get_font ()
refsect2.para: Get the font and other attributes at the current iterator position.

listitem.simpara: a PangoFontDescription to fill in with the current values. The family name in this structure will be set using pango_font_description_set_family_static using values from an attribute in the PangoAttrList associated with the iterator, so if you plan to keep it around, you must call: pango_font_description_set_family (desc, pango_font_description_get_family (desc)).
if non-NULL, location to store language tag for item, or NULL if non is found.

if non-NULL, location in which to store a list of non-font attributes at the the current position; only the highest priority value of each attribute will be added to this list. In order to free this value, you must call pango_attribute_destroy() on each member.

refsect2.title: pango_attr_iterator_get_attrs ()
refsect2.para: Gets a list all attributes a the current position of the iterator.

listitem.simpara: a list of all attributes for the current range. To free this value, call pango_attribute_destroy() on each value and g_slist_free() on the list.

refsect2.title: pango_attr_iterator_destroy ()
refsect2.para: Destroy a PangoAttrIterator and free all associated memory.
